text: Whew! I vented on the maga person earlier now I'm calm enough to comment on this video. The chili is delicious and rich, but, coming from the south, I'd not call it chili, I call it stew. I like ground beef, I know I know, Alison doesn't, and I like it a bit sweeter. I can't tell off the bat what was definitely missing for me to define it as chili? Anyhow, the cornbread, absolutely delicious and that was knocked out of the ballpark. Thank you Alison for your recipes. Your Thanksgiving stuffing is my go to. Happy Thanksgiving everyone. Despite that fact that arguably more than half of the country is in mourning, I do have faith in America. The next four years will be tough, and yes, I wish I had the means to move to a foreign country and wake up when the nightmare is over, but that's another four years out of my life and I won't let THAT person ruin it for me. Yes, families and friendships are being destroyed as we speak, the country wasn't recovered from the first four years, yes, flirting with UBER rich to elect a POTUS smells of fascism, and yes, women and gays? Good luck to us. Nonetheless, I'm grateful to be alive, sort of.

text: I think the reason Alison is mentioning nasty comments is because in the last video, she got attacked for saying she is supporting Kamala Harris for president, instead of the narcissistic liar and woman hater. We are here to follow along with her cooking and baking‚Ä¶ not to belittle or insult! I‚Äôm from the US and our political climate is getting angrier and more dangerous with each passing day. It‚Äôs embarrassing to even admit that I am American, because of the way these idiots put down and belittle our democracy. It‚Äôs sad and pathetic
author: @lisaanderson135

text: ¬†@lisaanderson135¬†the right path is rarely easy
author: @solomonsiddiq5478

text: ‚Äã¬†@lisaanderson135¬† Did you read your comment?  You did the very belittling and insulting that you are commenting about. Look in the mirror because most Americans do not see it as you do and it's not because of racism or hatefulness. The right is not angry, but the left is which they have been for a long time. Too many are suffering in this country and very little caring from your side. That's why the tide changed. Start caring a little bit more for us and maybe the tide will go your way again. You are right it is sad and pathetic not to care about so many of us. It's okay to have a political opinion but it's not okay to belittle, discriminate and be hateful of others because you do not agree. Look in the mirror. Having said all that, I did not see her video, but I'm absolutely not surprise that she was on Kamala's side because she is not suffering financially, and she's always been obvious about her beliefs. So, I'm not sure why anyone got on her unless she got rude about the other side. Just look at the chili she is making. Using expensive meat. I can barely buy ground beef and usually don't. It's not just me because so many of us are in that situation. That is not her concern nor yours, but for many Americans it is. People that are worried about paying their mortgage, bills and trying to make it to the end of the month are not going to be worried about progressive ideals, but you are and so is she and that is why your side lost.  I can still see Alison as a nice person even if she did not vote as I did, but people on your side are so prejudice towards anyone that sees things differently that I doubt that you would watch her if she was Republican.
author: @sandy-ke1kr

text: ¬†@sandy-ke1kr¬†  listen, I don‚Äôt hate people who don‚Äôt agree with my views and beliefs. Heck, I have many friends who are republicans or conservative liberals. I just want to point out, the majority of the hate and racism came from him and some of his followers. He is the one who keeps calling people immature names (Sleepy Joe or Gavin New *Scum?) and using racist diatribe‚Äôs (calling AG Letitia James- Letitia ‚Äúpeekaboo James‚Äù, which is an extremely racist slur that starts with the letter J). He unleashes these things at people who don‚Äôt agree or share his POV. Again, I‚Äôm not here to argue‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm here to watch and learn how to make a chili. I am also on disability. So I‚Äôm not in the same situation as Alison‚Äôs. I‚Äôm terrified of losing my healthcare and monthly stipend (as measly as it is). I‚Äôll be able to get by without the monthly payments, but I‚Äôm screwed if I lose my healthcare. I think my original comment was directed at my frustrations of the outcome of the election. Not directing it at just one person.

text: I was lazy (and short on time) and made the short version which did not disappoint!! It was delicious, even immediately after making. My only "complaint" would be that I also used a 5.5 qt Le Creuset Dutch oven and there was no way the entire recipe would fit. After adding the beer and tomatoes, it was almost overflowing and I had not yet added the 4 cups of water or any of the beans. So I had to get another large pot and divvy it up mid-way through cooking which was a bit annoying. But everything turned out great in the end! Just a note of caution if you decide to make the short version- prepare 2 pots or halve the recipe. In the end it was enough to feed probably 10 people.
